title.narrative: Education for Sustainable Development (ESD) Capacity development

description.narrative: Det huvudsakliga och övergripande målet med insatsen (impact) är att stärka skol- och yrkeselevers förmåga att leva hållbart (ekonomiskt, socialt och miljömässigt) och därmed bidra till ökad resiliens i södra Afrika. Detta sker genom att integrera utbildning för hållbar utveckling/Education for Sustainable Development (ESD) i utbildning och fortbildning av lärare, i policies och styrdokument för skolsystem, samt genom en introduktion av uppföljnings- och utvärderingsmetoder vad gäller utbildning för hållbar utveckling/Education for Sustainable Development (ESD) till det formella skolsystemet.

The overarching objective of the programme (impact) is to strengthen the capabilities of students in pre-primary, primary and secondary school, and in technical and vocational training, towards living and working in a sustainable way (economically, socially and environmentally). This will contribute to strengthened resilience in the SADC region. Education for Sustainable Development (ESD) will be integrated in the training and re-training of teachers, mainstreamed into education policy, and introduced into monitoring and evaluation mechanisms of the formal education system.

description.narrative: The advanced training programme was designed around the following 4 pillars: 1. issue-based curriculum strategy; 2. culture and heritage in education; 3. curriculum theory, and 4. assessment. The programme has previously been delivered through various sessions including presentations, individual reflections, small focus group discussions, fieldwork, plenary sessions, working with text, demonstrations, practical activities, as well as excursions. The country teams have started to work on their change projects. It is unknown how far they have come in the project work. Policy dialogues were to have taken place in the beginning of 2020, according to plan, but there are delays. Further reporting on the results of the change projects and the policy-related work was to take place in the narrative report in 2020, but there was little to report. The first narrative report on 2019 was submitted on 1 May 2020, after a one month delay due to Covid and logistical difficulties. The annual consultation with UNESCO took place digitally on 1 June 2020. The report for 2020 was submitted 21 April 2021. Due to Covid and changes in programming as well as the UNESCO World Conference on ESD scheduled in mid May 2021, an early yearly consultation meeting took place on 2 February 2021. We discussed:- the next narrative report is due on 1 April 2021 (1 May for financial report). It should focus on how Covid affected program implementation and on outcome level objectives as well as the potential of alumni networks. A year extension is recommended so the new end of agreement would be 2024-06-30, with end of activity 2023-12-31. An evaluation will be later as Covid is still affecting the program rate of implementation. Either late 2022 or in 2023 was suggested depending on the extension and planned activity (better to have evaluation while still ongoing program activities). 14th April workshop prior to the World Conference on ESD duly noted The Covid crisis slowed down certain activities while other ones were completely stopped, such as high level meetings with ministers and other government officials. Excellent progress was made on the database of and the building of a network of former participants. This is now available on UNESCO's website. This is showcased during the UNESCO World Conference and at CAPDEV's Partners meeting 3 June 2021. The program is now entering its final year of funding and 2 years of activity, and an evaluation was discussed but due to Covid pandemic it was decided to wait until 2022 to be able to harvest results. The evaluation will be organised by and administered by the UNESCO team, keeping Sida informed along the way. While this is the final year of funding, it is likely that the program will be extend into 2022 and perhaps even into 2023 due to delays caused by the Covid pandemic. Activities and Results during 2020 (and up to May 2021): 1. Database completed and online at Sustainability Starts with Teachers, http://sustainabilityteachers.org 2. Preparations for ESD World Conference, (May 17-19 2021) 3. National Meetings held with Tanzania 4. Consolidation of the status of ESD in Education sector in all participating countries material is now available on the website. Also program material is published online. Due to Covid this became more acute and necessary for participants, alumni, and is even now available for all interested in ESD training materials. 5. Postponed Policy Dialogues held online (11 - 12 May 2021).
